intro: Bartonia albescens, commonly known as the white bartonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Bartonia albescens is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
